questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington was the first President of the United States and never lived in the White House. Memory tip: Washington = First, but White House came after
questions.source: Britannica, National Archives, White House Historical Association

questions.question: Which four presidents are carved into Mount Rushmore?
questions.explanation: Mount Rushmore features Washington, Jefferson, Theodore Roosevelt, and Lincoln. Memory tip: W-J-T-L: Washington founded it, Jefferson expanded it, Teddy charged it, Lincoln saved it

questions.question: Which president served the most terms?
questions.answer: FDR was elected to four terms
questions.explanation: FDR was elected to four terms, the most of any president, serving from 1933-1945. Memory tip: FDR = Four terms, led during Depression and World War
questions.source: FDR Presidential Library, Britannica, National Archives

questions.question: Which president had the shortest term?
questions.answer: William Henry Harrison served only 31 days
questions.explanation: William Henry Harrison served only 31 days, the shortest presidency. Memory tip: Harrison = Hardly in office

questions.question: Where was Abraham Lincoln assassinated?
questions.answer: Abraham Lincoln was assassinated on April 14
questions.explanation: Abraham Lincoln was assassinated on April 14, 1865, at Ford's Theatre by John Wilkes Booth. Memory tip: Lincoln at theatre = Booth shot from booth
questions.source: National Park Service, Britannica, Ford's Theatre

questions.question: Who was the youngest elected president?
questions.explanation: John F. Kennedy was the youngest elected president at age 43. Memory tip: JFK = Just Forty-three Kinetic

questions.question: Which president resigned from office?
questions.answer: Richard Nixon was the only president to resign
questions.explanation: Richard Nixon was the only president to resign, in 1974 due to the Watergate scandal. Memory tip: Nixon = Only one to resign
questions.source: National Archives, Britannica, Nixon Presidential Library

questions.question: Which president served non-consecutive terms?
questions.explanation: Grover Cleveland is the only president to serve non-consecutive terms (22nd and 24th president). Memory tip: Cleveland = Came back around

questions.question: Who was the first American Nobel Peace Prize winner?
questions.explanation: Theodore Roosevelt was the first American to win the Nobel Peace Prize. Memory tip: Teddy = First to get Nobel (peacefully)

questions.question: Which president later became Chief Justice?
questions.explanation: William Howard Taft is the only president to also serve on the Supreme Court. Memory tip: Taft = Two top jobs

questions.question: When did the American Civil War take place?
questions.explanation: The Civil War lasted from 1861 to 1865. Memory tip: 1861-65: The sixties divided the states
questions.source: National Archives, Britannica, National Park Service

questions.question: When was Pearl Harbor attacked?
questions.answer: Pearl Harbor was attacked on December 7
questions.explanation: Pearl Harbor was attacked on December 7, 1941, bringing the US into World War II. Memory tip: 12/7/41 = Seven-Eleven in reverse, plus 30
questions.source: National WWII Museum, Britannica, National Archives

questions.question: When was D-Day?
questions.explanation: D-Day occurred on June 6, 1944, when Allied forces invaded Normandy. Memory tip: 6/6/44 = Double sixes for the invasion
questions.source: National WWII Museum, Britannica, US Army

questions.question: What battle was the turning point of the Civil War?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Gettysburg (July 1-3, 1863) was the turning point of the Civil War. Memory tip: Gettysburg = Get turned around (turning point)

questions.question: When did Lincoln issue the Emancipation Proclamation?
questions.answer: The Emancipation Proclamation was issued on January 1
questions.explanation: The Emancipation Proclamation was issued on January 1, 1863. Memory tip: 1863 = Same year as Gettysburg

questions.question: When did World War II take place?
questions.explanation: World War II lasted from 1939 to 1945. Memory tip: WWII = 39 to 45, six years of war

questions.question: Which two Japanese cities were hit by atomic bombs?
questions.answer: Atomic bombs were dropped on Hiroshima (August 6) and Nagasaki (August 9)
questions.explanation: Atomic bombs were dropped on Hiroshima (August 6) and Nagasaki (August 9), 1945. Memory tip: H comes before N: Hiroshima then Nagasaki
questions.source: Britannica, National WWII Museum, US Department of Energy

questions.question: Who led Britain during World War II?
questions.explanation: Winston Churchill was Prime Minister of Britain during most of WWII. Memory tip: Churchill = Cigar-smoking British bulldog

questions.question: Who wrote a famous diary while hiding from Nazis?
questions.explanation: Anne Frank wrote her diary while hiding in Amsterdam during the Holocaust. Memory tip: Anne Frank = Amsterdam attic

questions.question: Who was the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during WWII?
questions.explanation: Dwight Eisenhower was Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during WWII. Memory tip: Ike = I led in Europe
questions.source: Britannica, National WWII Museum, Eisenhower Presidential Library

questions.question: When was Julius Caesar assassinated?
questions.answer: Julius Caesar was assassinated on the Ides of March (March 15)
questions.explanation: Julius Caesar was assassinated on the Ides of March (March 15), 44 BC. Memory tip: Ides of March = March 15

questions.question: When did the French Revolution begin?
questions.explanation: The French Revolution began in 1789 with the storming of the Bastille on July 14. Memory tip: 1789 = Same year as US Constitution ratification

questions.question: When did the Berlin Wall fall?
questions.answer: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989. Memory tip: 1989 = Fall of the Wall, fall of communism

questions.question: Who was Egypt's last pharaoh?
questions.explanation: Cleopatra was the last pharaoh of ancient Egypt. Memory tip: Cleopatra = Closed Egypt's pharaoh era

questions.question: When was the Magna Carta signed?
questions.answer: The Magna Carta was signed in 1215 at Runnymede
questions.explanation: The Magna Carta was signed in 1215 at Runnymede, England. Memory tip: 1215 = 12 for December, 15 for day (though actually June)

questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.answer: The largest organ in the human body
questions.explanation: The largest organ in the human body is the skin. Memory tip: Skin = Covers everything, so it's largest

questions.question: How many bones are in the adult human body?
questions.explanation: Adults have 206 bones in their body. Memory tip: 206 = Two hundred and six bones in grown folks
questions.source: Britannica, National Institutes of Health, Gray's Anatomy

questions.question: What is the hardest substance in the human body?
questions.explanation: Tooth enamel is the hardest substance in the human body. Memory tip: Enamel = Extra hard to protect teeth

questions.question: Approximately how many times does the human heart beat in one day?
questions.explanation: The heart beats about 100,000 times per day. Memory tip: 100,000 beats = 100K a day keeps you alive

questions.question: What is the smallest bone in the human body?
questions.explanation: The smallest bone is the stapes (stirrup bone) in the middle ear. Memory tip: Stapes = Tiny stirrup in your ear

questions.question: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.answer: The cheetah is the fastest land animal
questions.explanation: The cheetah is the fastest land animal, reaching speeds up to 70 mph. Memory tip: Cheetah = Cheater speeds

questions.question: What is the largest animal ever to exist?
questions.explanation: The blue whale is the largest animal that has ever lived on Earth. Memory tip: Blue whale = Bigger than everything

questions.question: How many bones do sharks have?
questions.explanation: Sharks have no bones - their skeleton is made entirely of cartilage. Memory tip: Sharks = Same as your nose (cartilage)

questions.question: How many bones are in a giraffe's neck?
questions.explanation: Giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae as humans: 7. Memory tip: 7 neck bones = Same as humans, just longer

questions.question: How many hearts does an octopus have?
questions.explanation: Octopuses have three hearts. Memory tip: Octopus = Three hearts for eight arms
questions.source: National Geographic, Britannica, Monterey Bay Aquarium

questions.question: What is the chemical formula for water?
questions.explanation: H2O is the chemical formula for water. Memory tip: H2O = Two H's, one O

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: Gold's chemical symbol is Au, from the Latin word 'aurum'. Memory tip: Au = Ancient word for gold

questions.question: How many elements are on the periodic table?
questions.explanation: The periodic table has 118 confirmed elements. Memory tip: 118 = As of 2016, complete to period 7

questions.question: Which element is most abundant in the universe?
questions.explanation: Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe. Memory tip: Hydrogen = Everywhere in space

questions.question: What is the only metal that is liquid at room temperature?
questions.answer: Mercury is the only metal that
questions.explanation: Mercury is the only metal that is liquid at room temperature. Memory tip: Mercury = Metal that's liquid (like the planet is fluid)

questions.question: How many planets are in our solar system?
questions.explanation: There are 8 planets in our solar system. Memory tip: 8 planets = Since Pluto got demoted

questions.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system. Memory tip: Jupiter = Jumbo planet

questions.question: Which planet is the hottest in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system. Memory tip: Venus = Thick atmosphere traps heat

questions.question: How long does it take light from the sun to reach Earth?
questions.explanation: Light from the Sun takes about 8 minutes to reach Earth. Memory tip: 8 minutes = Time for sunlight to arrive

questions.question: What is the speed of light?
questions.answer: The speed of light is approximately 186
questions.explanation: The speed of light is approximately 186,000 miles per second. Memory tip: 186,000 mps = Light speed limit
questions.source: NASA, Britannica, National Institute of Standards

questions.question: What is the tallest mountain above sea level?
questions.answer: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain above sea level at 29
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain above sea level at 29,032 feet. Memory tip: Everest = Highest peak you can see

questions.question: What percentage of Earth's surface is covered by water?
questions.explanation: About 71% of Earth's surface is covered in water. Memory tip: 70-71% = Most of Earth is ocean

questions.question: What is the largest desert in the world?
questions.explanation: Antarctica is the largest desert in the world. Memory tip: Antarctica = Desert is defined by precipitation, not temperature

questions.question: How many colors are in a rainbow?
questions.answer: A rainbow has seven colors: red
questions.explanation: A rainbow has seven colors: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet. Memory tip: ROY G. BIV = Rainbow colors

questions.question: Which rock floats on water?
questions.explanation: Pumice is the only rock that floats on water. Memory tip: Pumice = Porous, so it floats

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital of France. Memory tip: Paris = City of Light, French capital

questions.question: What is the capital of Canada?
questions.explanation: Ottawa is the capital of Canada. Memory tip: Ottawa = Often forgotten Canadian capital

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital of Australia. Memory tip: Canberra = Compromise between Sydney and Melbourne

questions.question: What is the largest country in South America?
questions.explanation: Brazil is the largest country in South America. Memory tip: Brazil = Big country with Amazon

questions.question: What is the largest country in the world?
questions.explanation: Russia is the largest country in the world by area. Memory tip: Russia = Ridiculously large

questions.question: How many states are in the United States?
questions.explanation: There are 50 states in the United States. Memory tip: 50 states = 50 stars on flag

questions.question: What is the largest US state?
questions.explanation: Alaska is the largest US state by area. Memory tip: Alaska = A lot of land

questions.question: What is the longest river in the United States?
questions.explanation: The Mississippi River is the longest river in the United States. Memory tip: Mississippi = Mighty river down the middle

questions.question: What is the capital of the United States?
questions.explanation: Washington, D.C. is the capital of the United States. Memory tip: Washington D.C. = Where the president lives

questions.question: In which state is the Grand Canyon located?
questions.explanation: The Grand Canyon is located in Arizona. Memory tip: Arizona = Arid zone with Grand Canyon

questions.question: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile is traditionally considered the longest river in the world. Memory tip: Nile = Number one river (traditionally)

questions.question: What is the largest ocean?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean. Memory tip: Pacific = Plenty big ocean

questions.question: What is the largest hot desert?
questions.explanation: The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world. Memory tip: Sahara = Sandy hot desert

questions.question: What is the deepest point in the ocean?
questions.answer: The Mariana Trench is the deepest point in the ocean at about 36
questions.explanation: The Mariana Trench is the deepest point in the ocean at about 36,000 feet. Memory tip: Mariana = Deepest marine area

questions.question: Which mountain range contains the world's highest peaks?
questions.explanation: The Himalayas contain the world's highest mountains. Memory tip: Himalayas = High mountain range in Asia

questions.question: Where is the Eiffel Tower located?
questions.answer: The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris
questions.explanation: The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris, France. Memory tip: Eiffel = French landmark

questions.question: Which country gave the Statue of Liberty to the US?
questions.explanation: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States. Memory tip: Liberty = Gift from France

questions.question: What is the longest wall in the world?
questions.explanation: The Great Wall of China is the longest wall in the world. Memory tip: Great Wall = Greatest wall on Earth

questions.question: What is Big Ben?
questions.explanation: Big Ben is the nickname for the Great Bell in the clock tower at Westminster Palace in London. Memory tip: Big Ben = Bell, not the tower

questions.question: Where is the Taj Mahal located?
questions.answer: The Taj Mahal is located in Agra
questions.explanation: The Taj Mahal is located in Agra, India. Memory tip: Taj Mahal = Tomb in India

questions.question: What do the stripes on the American flag represent?
questions.explanation: The American flag has 13 stripes representing the original 13 colonies. Memory tip: 13 stripes = 13 original colonies

questions.question: What do the stars on the American flag represent?
questions.explanation: The American flag has 50 stars representing the 50 states. Memory tip: 50 stars = 50 states

questions.question: What symbol is on the Canadian flag?
questions.explanation: The Canadian flag features a red maple leaf. Memory tip: Canada = Maple leaf flag

questions.question: What is the flag of the United Kingdom called?
questions.explanation: The Union Jack is the flag of the United Kingdom. Memory tip: Union Jack = UK flag union

questions.question: Which country has a non-rectangular flag?
questions.answer: Nepal has the only national flag that
questions.explanation: Nepal has the only national flag that is not rectangular. Memory tip: Nepal = Not rectangular flag
